docs.lead_paragraph: The more interesting political divide may be between President Obama and the growing ranks of Republican governors who will help decide the fate of many of his policies.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Governors Ready to the Hold Line On Obama Policies
headline.main: G.O.P. Governors Ready to Hold Line on Obama Policies
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Governors Ready to Hold Line On Obama Policies

docs.abstract: News analysis; more interesting political divide than just Democratic president battling with Republican house may be between Pres Obama and growing ranks of Republican governors who will help decide fate of many of his policies; several make clear at Republican Governors Association meeting in Las Vegas that they will sometimes try to check Obama's powers.
docs.snippet: The more interesting political divide may be between President Obama and the growing ranks of Republican governors who will help decide the fate of many of his policies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Investors anxious about automatic tax increases on Dec. 31, should President Obama and Congress fail to agree on a plan to avoid them, should exercise prudence in trying to minimize exposure.

headline.seo: Advisers Caution Against Hasty Decisions in Advance of Tax Changes
headline.main: More Costly Than Higher Taxes: Rash Decisions
headline.print_headline: More Costly Than Higher Taxes: Rash Decisions

docs.abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column says investors anxious about automatic tax increases on Dec 31, if President Obama and Congress fail to agree on a plan to avoid them, should exercise prudence in trying to minimize exposure.
docs.snippet: Investors anxious about automatic tax increases on Dec. 31, should President Obama and Congress fail to agree on a plan to avoid them, should exercise prudence in trying to minimize exposure.

docs.abstract: Several Republican governors have refused to set up insurance exchanges in their states, meaning the federal government will assume responsibility instead.
docs.snippet: Several Republican governors have refused to set up insurance exchanges in their states, meaning the federal government will assume responsibility instead.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. P. Murali Doraiswamy of Duke University addresses reader questions about Alzheimer’s disease and other memory problems.
docs.snippet: Dr. P. Murali Doraiswamy of Duke University addresses reader questions about Alzheimer’s disease and other memory problems.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Housing Administration, a government agency that insures mortgages, has a shortfall of $16.3 billion.

headline.seo: F.H.A., Short Billions, May Need Rescue by Taxpayers

docs.abstract: Independent audit reveals Federal Housing Administration, government agency that insures mortgages, is on the verge of requiring taxpayer financing for the first time in its eight-decade history; audit projects a total shortfall of about $16.3 billion, even as the agency's reserves fell to $3 billion in 2011.
docs.snippet: The Federal Housing Administration, a government agency that insures mortgages, has a shortfall of $16.3 billion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Families facing a diagnosis of the disease can only ask: Should they live their lives differently, get their affairs in order, join a clinical trial of an experimental drug?

headline.main: For Alzheimer’s, Detection Advances Outpace Treatment Options
headline.print_headline: For Alzheimer’s, Detection Advances Outpace Treatment Options

docs.abstract: New brain scan technology that detects early stages of Alzheimer's forces families who receive diagnosis of essentially untreatable disease to wonder if they should live their lives differently, get their affairs in order or join clinical trial of an experimental drug; issue highlights problem of new era of Alzheimer's research, in which ability to detect disease has leapt far ahead of treatments.
docs.snippet: Families facing a diagnosis of the disease can only ask: Should they live their lives differently, get their affairs in order, join a clinical trial of an experimental drug?

docs.lead_paragraph: Many Republican governors had delayed acting on the health care law in the hope of a Romney presidency that would push to overturn the law.

headline.seo: States’ Deadline Extended for Insurance Exchanges
headline.main: U.S. Extends Deadline for States on Health Insurance Exchanges
headline.print_headline: U.S. Extends Deadline for States On Health Insurance Exchanges

docs.abstract: Obama administration, for second time in week, says it is extending deadline until mid-December for states to decide whether they will establish and operate online markets where consumers can shop for health insurance under the new health care law.
docs.snippet: Many Republican governors had delayed acting on the health care law in the hope of a Romney presidency that would push to overturn the law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Li Keqiang has been exposed to a rich palette of liberal thinking, but he will be hemmed in by the conservatives who dominate the seven-seat Politburo Standing Committee.

headline.seo: Li Keqiang Named China’s Prime Minister
headline.main: Liberal Background, but Limited Leeway, for a New Premier
headline.print_headline: Liberal Background, But Limited Leeway, For a New Premier
headline.content_kicker: Man in the News | Li Keqiang

docs.abstract: Man in the News profile of Li Keqiang, who will step into role of China's prime minister in 2013; Li, who has been exposed to rich palette of liberal thinking, carries hopes of reform-minded members of his generation, but will be hemmed in by conservatives dominating seven-seat Politburo Standing Committee.
docs.snippet: Li Keqiang has been exposed to a rich palette of liberal thinking, but he will be hemmed in by the conservatives who dominate the seven-seat Politburo Standing Committee.

byline.contributor: Ian Johnson contributed reporting. Patrick Zuo, Amy Qin and Chang Lu contributed research.

docs.lead_paragraph: Raising the retirement age on Social Security and Medicare would be a harsh blow to Americans in the bottom half of the income distribution.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column disputes validity of idea that raising retirement age on Social Security and age of eligibility for Medicare is necessary given longer life expectancy and need for deficit reduction; contends idea, if implemented, would be harsh blow to most vulnerable Americans, and containing rise of health care costs would be better way to cut deficit.
docs.snippet: Raising the retirement age on Social Security and Medicare would be a harsh blow to Americans in the bottom half of the income distribution.

headline.main: Providers Push Back on Medicaid Inquiries
headline.print_headline: Providers Push Back On Medicaid Inquiries

docs.snippet: Big and prosperous medical practices under investigation by the state say they are being wrongly targeted because they are successful.
